summary: This is an email forwarded within the Bureau of Prisons on August 10, 2019, containing a message from a BuzzFeed News reporter. The reporter, Jane Lytvynenko, alerts officials to a potential leak, stating that posts on 4chan about Jeffrey Epstein's death appeared 45 minutes before mainstream media reports, and she suspects a paramedic involved in the response may have been the source.

persons.name: Lamine N'Diaye
persons.context: Appears as the recipient of the forwarded email within the Bureau of Prisons system.

persons.name: Jane Lytvynenko
persons.context: BuzzFeed News reporter who sent the original email alerting about potential leaks from paramedics regarding Epstein's death, based on 4chan posts.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the reported death; the email concerns a potential leak of information about his death.

connections.description: Lytvynenko, a reporter, is contacting N'Diaye, a BOP official, regarding a potential security leak about Epstein's death.
Lytvynenko is investigating and reporting on the circumstances and potential leaks surrounding Epstein's death.

events.title: Reporter alerts BOP to potential leak
events.description: BuzzFeed News reporter Jane Lytvynenko emails the Bureau of Prisons, stating that posts on 4chan about Jeffrey Epstein's death appeared 45 minutes before ABC News reported it, suggesting a paramedic may have leaked information.

events.title: Epstein's death reported
events.description: The email references that ABC News first reported Epstein's death on this date, but posts on 4chan appeared 45 minutes earlier.

keyFacts: A BuzzFeed News reporter contacted the Bureau of Prisons on August 10, 2019, about a potential leak regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Posts on the website 4chan about Epstein's death were published 45 minutes before ABC News first reported it.
The reporter suspected that one of the paramedics involved in responding to the Epstein call may have been the source of the leaked information posted online.
